text:
Hi all, bit of a long shot - but does anyone know it is possible to remove "Resizing handles" on pictures that dont have a link in emails (outlook)? see image.
An easy option is adding a blank href but for images that are used as background it messes with the buttons and links that are on top of it (no z-index og positioning in email :disappointed: )

Hope someone can help :slightly_smiling_face:

I don't believe this is possible without linking the image. Outlook uses Word as its rendering engine, so that is my guess why you see those resizing handles.

You're also better off not doing a blank/empty href in a link, as that causes issues with Office 365 and <http://Outlook.com|Outlook.com> (see: <https://github.com/hteumeuleu/email-bugs/issues/10>). You should always use a URL in a link.

I think entirely depends on your team's workflow, where you want email content to live, how often they will be updated, which teams/members need to be involved, etc. For example, we are moving our transactional emails to HubSpot, and are going to be using the Single-send API so that marketing can own the content of the emails within the HubSpot UI and update as needed, while development will set up the API calls.
